intro: Solenospermum wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pale yellow with five petals. The fruit, which is edible, turns from green to yellow as it matures and is often consumed fresh or used in local cuisines.
